overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting using simple averaging due to limited historical records (96 hourly points). It prioritizes capturing daily seasonality while acknowledging data constraints prevent more complex modeling. The method focuses on computational feasibility and pattern stability, resulting in a baseline forecast by repeating averaged hourly patterns.
common_data_patterns: No missing values in historical data
Limited trend detection due to short history
key_insights: Prioritization of daily seasonality over weekly patterns due to insufficient data
Use of hourly averaging as a baseline method for short-term forecasts
Explicit handling of datetime alignment for pattern repetition
Rounding considerations for output precision matching input data
complexity_analysis: Moderately detailed with practical constraints: Includes method comparison (SARIMA/Exponential Smoothing) but defaults to simple heuristics due to data limitations. Features multi-step data reshaping and datetime handling, yet maintains computational simplicity.
